customer_reviews.title: Stellar Study Guide!
customer_reviews.text: If you are taking the licensure exam for Property Casualty Insurance than you definitely need to invest in this study guide. This guide is filled with 153 pages of practice questions, answer explanations and test-taking strategies. This book breaks down the learning material into 7 main subjects that include: property policies, property insurance terms & related concepts, property policy provisions & contract law, types of casualty policies & bonds, casualty insurance terms & related concepts, and casualty policy provisions. If you need a thorough study guide for this type of exam you won’t go wrong with purchasing this book!
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Great study material
customer_reviews.text: This is a great study guide for the PCIL exam. This guide is very well organized, so it's easy to find the specific content material that you're looking for. There are five sections of practice test questions, each after its specific content section. I found this to be more useful because I could study with the prep questions for exact sections instead of weeding through a big comprehensive practice test at the end. This guide has a lot of good information in it and it's also written for the 2018-2019 exam, so the content is likely to be more relevant than similar guides. I'd recommend this study guide to others.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Frost

customer_reviews.title: The Study Guide a Cliff's Note Aspires to Become
customer_reviews.text: I thought this study guide book was an excellent source for a person who has studied for the property and casualty insurance licensure exam. It's in plain English, but detailed. It breaks down each and every aspect of the insurances, explains in detail the hows and whys, and provides practice questions and answers for each section. Although I have no intention of becoming an insurance agent, I will keep this study guide for my own reference and personal use when it comes to understanding my auto insurance and renter's insurance policies. This is a study guide that the average person can use without feeling like they need an engineering degree to decipher it.
